newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Low-grown tea prices recover at Colombo auction.
newsitem.headline: Low-grown tea prices recover at Colombo auction.

text.p: Prices for Sri Lanka's distinct low-grown teas picked up at the Colombo auction for the first time in more than a month while good demand for high and mid-growns kept the market buoyant, brokers said on Wednesday.
"Most highs and mid-growns picked up on good general demand," a broker at Forbes & Walker said. "The quality season is upon us now and that will have an impact on the overall market."
Prices of low-growns, which eased over the past month, picked up on improved demand from Turkey, the Commonwealth of Independent States, the Middle East and Germany, the broker said.
The anticipated auction average price for the 4.7 million kg on offer was 107 rupees ($1.92) per kg, compared to 105.08 rupees last week.
The next auction is on August 26-27 when 4.3 million kg will be on offer. ($1 = 55.79 rupees)
